issue.title: [Bug]: Minimized window stops painting when backgroundThrottling is false (Windows 10)

repository.name: electron
repository.description: :electron: Build cross-platform desktop apps with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS

issue.body:
### Preflight Checklist

### Electron Version

22.0.0

### What operating system are you using?

Windows

### Operating System Version

Windows 10

### What arch are you using?

x64

### Last Known Working Electron version

_No response_

### Expected Behavior

Minimized windows continues to paint and is not throttled. Works on Mac version where minimized window continues to paint when background throttling is false.

### Actual Behavior

Minimized window content stays blank. No paint events are generated.

### Testcase Gist URL

_No response_

### Additional Information

_No response_

issue.title: [Bug]: backgroundThrottling: false can prevent DOM being visible to testing tools

repository.name: electron
repository.description: :electron: Build cross-platform desktop apps with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS

issue.body:
### Preflight Checklist

- [X] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) for this project.
- [X] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) that this project adheres to.
- [X] I have searched the [issue tracker](https://www.github.com/electron/electron/issues) for a bug report that matches the one I want to file, without success.

### Electron Version

23.1.0. happened in 19 too

### What operating system are you using?

Windows

### Operating System Version

windows 10 21H2

### What arch are you using?

x64

### Last Known Working Electron version

_No response_

### Expected Behavior

Electron window is started with --remote-debugging-port=9223. Then a test automation tool like Ranorex or a tool like microsoft inspect can spy the electron window to read and/or interact with the DOM. It should be always able to see the whole DOM with all elements. 

Tools:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/winauto/inspect-objects
https://www.ranorex.com/

### Actual Behavior

Good: 
when backgroundThrottling: **true (default)**, the expected behavior is working.

Bad: 
when backgroundThrottling: **false** is set, the DOM will be hidden after another window hid the electron windows once completley. 
Steps to reproduce:
+ start a spy tool like the one from Ranorex or microsoft and check the electron window. 
= you will see all DOM elements (good)
+ move a different window above half of the electron window, Then spy with the spy tool again
= you will see all DOM elements (good)
+ move a different window above the electron window so that it COMPLETELY hides the electron window,
+ bring the electron window into the forground again and try to spy on the window
= you wont be able to see any DOM elements. the dom is empty (bad)
+ resize the electron window by making it full screen and then back to the regular size again. Try to spy on the window again
= you will see all DOM elements (good)

was reproducable with different electron apps.  Can be reproduced by using the official electron quickstart repo, add backgroundThrottling: false and adding electron-builder to create a bundle (or probably just bundling it manually should work too).

This will be also reported to Ranorex, but i wanted to let you know, too. Because the same behavior can be reproduced with two tools (microsoft inspect) so it is probably a general problem with electron.

### Testcase Gist URL

_No response_

### Additional Information

I do not know if those issues could be related:
https://github.com/electron/electron/issues/31016
https://github.com/electron/electron/issues/36707

issue.title: fix: disable background throttling also in the `viz::DisplayScheduler`

repository.name: electron
repository.description: :electron: Build cross-platform desktop apps with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS

issue.body:
#### Description of Change

`viz::DisplayScheduler` is responsible for drawing and swapping frames in the `DisplayScheduler::DrawAndSwap` which is called from the `DisplayScheduler::AttemptDrawAndSwap` if the `DisplayScheduler::ShouldDraw` returns true. `ShouldDraw` depends on the `DisplayScheduler` visibility and when it is not visible then it returns false.

In order to keep producing frames, disabling `backgroundThrottling` should also prevent changing `DisplayScheduler` visibility to false.

`DisplayScheduler` lives in the `ui::Compositor` where every `electron::NativewWindow` has its own `Compositor`. `electron::NativewWindow` may be host of the multiple `electron::api::WebContents` instances which may have different `WebPreferences` settings. Therefore if at least one of the `WebContents` requires disabling throttling then all other `WebContents` using the same window will have it disabled in the `ui::Compositor`.

BREAKING CHANGE:
`backgroundThrottling` set to false will disable frames throttling in the `BrowserWindow` for all `WebContents` displayed by it.

Closes: [#31016](https://github.com/electron/electron/issues/31016)

<!--
Thank you for your Pull Request. Please provide a description above and review
the requirements below.

Contributors guide: https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

#### Checklist
<!-- Remove items that do not apply. For completed items, change [ ] to [x]. -->

- [x] PR description included and stakeholders cc'd
- [x] `npm test` passes
- [ ] tests are [changed or added](https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/main/docs/development/testing.md)
- [x] relevant documentation, tutorials, templates and examples are changed or added
- [x] PR release notes](https://github.com/electron/clerk/blob/main/README.md) describe the change in a way relevant to app developers, and are [capitalized, punctuated, and past tense](https://github.com/electron/clerk/blob/main/README.md#examples).

#### Release Notes

Notes: Fixed generating frames when the window is hidden and `backgroundThrottling` is disabled.
